A newspaper clipping featuring a portrait of a man identified as Leon Capeluto. He is shown from the chest up, wearing a dark suit and a patterned tie. The accompanying text describes his restaurant, Leon's Brass Rail, and mentions the Castle Club hosting Christmas parties. BRASS RAIL IS VERY POPULAR EATING PLACE. One of the most popular eating places in town is Leon's Brass Rail, on West Pack Square. Although it was only opened a short time ago it has gained in popularity from the day of its opening. Leon Capeluto, the proprietor, is well-known in Asheville's restaurant circles, having operated cafes in this city for a number of years. The Brass Rail features rotisserie and grill cooked meats at low prices. All kinds of drinks are served. Grill cooked hamburgers and weiners are very popular with the after-show crowds. CASTLE CLUB HOST TO MANY XMAS PARTIES. The Castle Asheville's finest night club has made most unusual preparations for the Christmas Holidays in anticipation of a large crowd. CORDOVAL Eliakim Italien
Agent commercial. Né à Rhodes, le 15 avril 1919.
Il travaille à Rhodes pendant 10 ans comme agent commercial. En 1944 il est déporté par les Allemands au camp d’Auschwitz. Libéré par les Russes en 1945, il s’engage dans leur armée jusqu’en octobre de la même année. Rentré en Italie, il travaille au service de renseignements des déportés à Rome. Né à Rhodes, le 13 septembre 1913. Après ses études, il est de 1933 à 1937, agent commercial en Italie. Le 14 mai 1937, il débarque au Congo Belge, au service de la firme « Moussafir Bension », puis, fin 1937, de la maison Israël Frères.
